meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Karen Ash Amy Schmidt Marissa Edelman Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #6994.

td.p: Karen Ash, a business analyst from Brooklyn, New York
Amy Schmidt, a psychometrician from Doylestown, Pennsylvania
Marissa Edelman, an attorney from Philadelphia, Pennsylvania (whose 1-day cash winnings total $9,400)

tr.td: NOBEL PEACE PRIZE WINNERS' HOME COUNTRIES
(Alex: ...we want you to name the first movie that popularized each film song.)

As The New York Times said, imagine if 9/11 had been followed by Super Storm Sandy; well, that\'s what would\'ve happened if not for the slurry wall, anchored in bedrock in the 1960s to prevent the waters of this river from seeping into the foundation of the towers')

As The New York Times said, imagine if 9/11 had been followed by Super Storm Sandy; well, that's what would've happened if not for the slurry wall, anchored in bedrock in the 1960s to prevent the waters of this river from seeping into the foundation of the towers

tr.td: (Alex: We'll give you the family members.)

div.h3: Scores at the end of the Double Jeopardy! Round:

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', '(Alex: [To Karen] ...representative of the Queen in India.)
AmyWhat is Lord Governor?
$800
MarissaWhat is Raj?
$8,500
KarenWhat is Viceroy of India?
$1,800
Viceroy of India')
div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', 'In 1858 rule of India went from the East India Company to the British Crown & Lord Canning became the first holder of this title')

tr.td: In 1858 rule of India went from the East India Company to the British Crown & Lord Canning became the first holder of this title

body.div: The J! Archive is created by fans, for fans. The Jeopardy! game show and all elements thereof, including but not limited to copyright and trademark thereto, are the property of Jeopardy Productions, Inc. and are protected under law. This website is not affiliated with, sponsored by, or operated by Jeopardy Productions, Inc. Join the discussion at JBoard.tv.
